description: A soft, fluffy white or whole wheat loaf, often used for sandwiches and toast.
A rich, buttery, and slightly sweet bread with a soft, airy texture, perfect for breakfast or desserts.
A tangy, chewy bread with a crisp crust, made through natural fermentation.
A soft, yeast-raised donut covered in a sweet, shiny sugar glaze.
A round donut with a fruity jam or jelly filling, dusted with powdered sugar.
A yeast donut filled with creamy custard and topped with a rich chocolate glaze.
A rectangular, bar-shaped donut, often filled with custard or cream and topped with icing.
A light, spongy cake rolled with various fillings like buttercream, chocolate, or fruit jam.
A tall, layered cake with multiple fillings, often frosted with buttercream or ganache.
A moist, spiced cake with grated carrots, nuts, and a rich cream cheese frosting.
A chocolate sponge cake layered with cherries and whipped cream, topped with chocolate shavings.
A crunchy or chewy cookie filled with rich chocolate chips.
A soft, hearty cookie made with oats and sweet raisins.
A cookie packed with a variety of nuts like cashews, almonds, or walnuts.
A thin, flaky pastry filled with sweet muscovado sugar and sometimes ube or mango.
A crumbly, buttery, and milky shortbread-like treat made with toasted flour and powdered milk.
A soft, sweet bread roll topped with butter, sugar, and grated cheese, often enjoyed as a merienda (snack).
A buttery crust filled with creamy custard and topped with a variety of fresh fruits like kiwi, strawberries, and mangoes.
A rich tart filled with caramelized mixed nuts such as almonds, cashews, and walnuts.
A flaky pastry shell filled with smooth, sweet egg custard, popular in Filipino bakeries.
A moist chocolate-flavored cupcake topped with rich chocolate frosting.
A soft cupcake filled with creamy custard and topped with whipped cream.
A mini cheesecake with a graham cracker crust, often topped with fruit compote.
A classic pie with a flaky crust and spiced apple filling.
A tropical twist on the classic pie, filled with sweet and juicy Philippine mangoes.
A flaky, buttery pastry filled with rich chocolate.
A savory croissant stuffed with crispy bacon and scrambled eggs, perfect for breakfast.
A croissant infused with cinnamon sugar, offering a sweet and spicy flavor.
A dense, fudgy, or cake-like chocolate bar, sometimes topped with nuts or drizzled with chocolate.
Deep-fried dough pastries dusted with powdered sugar, popular in New Orleans but also enjoyed in the Philippines.
Light and crumbly cakes, often layered with whipped cream and fresh fruits like strawberries.
A soft, creamy dessert made from milk, sugar, and a thickening agent, available in various flavors such as vanilla, chocolate, or bread pudding.
A sweet, rolled pastry filled with cinnamon-sugar mixture and topped with glaze or cream cheese frosting.
